Description: Mould-made pottery lamp decorated on the discus with three slave masks. The moulded rim is open near the nozzle and has turned-back ends. The angular shoulder has a rectangular panel each side, and is decorated with impressed ovules flanking the handle, shoulder-panels and nozzle. At the rear is a ring handle (broken). Within the pseudo-base-ring is the impressed name KA. Covered with an orange-red slip.
Curator's comments: An Egyptian version of a Channel-and-Panel lamp.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q2073)
